questions.question: 1. In the simulation, when you increased the quantum number n from 1 to 5, what did you observe about the number of peaks (antinodes)?

answers.b: Number of peaks remained the same
answers.c: Number of peaks increased to match n

explanations.c: The number of antinodes (peaks) in the wavefunction equals the quantum number n. So for n=5, there are exactly 5 peaks.

questions.question: 2. When you enabled the |Ψ|² (probability) display, at which positions was the probability zero?

answers.a: At the center of the box only
answers.b: At the boundaries and at the node positions

explanations.b: The probability density |Ψ|² is zero at the boundaries (x=0, x=L) and at all node positions where the wavefunction crosses zero.

questions.question: 3. Based on your observations, how did the energy change when you doubled the quantum number from n=2 to n=4?

explanations.b: Since E ∝ n², when n doubles from 2 to 4, the energy increases by a factor of (4/2)² = 4.

questions.question: 4. What did you observe about the wavelength when you increased the box length L?

explanations.b: The wavelength in a particle-in-a-box is λ = 2L/n wavelength increases proportionally with box length L.

questions.question: 5. In the Live Measurements panel, what was the relationship you observed between nodes and quantum number n?

explanations.c: From the simulation, you can verify that the number of nodes (zero crossings inside the box) equals n - 1 for quantum state n.

questions.question: 6. When comparing the ground state (n=1) with excited states (n>1), what did you notice about where the particle is most likely to be found?

answers.a: Always at the center for all states
answers.b: Always at the boundaries for all states
answers.c: At different positions depending on the quantum number

explanations.c: The probability distribution changes with n. For n=1, maximum probability is at center. For higher n, there are multiple maxima at antinode positions.

questions.question: 7. What happened to the oscillation frequency when you increased the quantum number n?

explanations.b: Higher energy states (higher n) have higher frequency of oscillation since ω ∝ E ∝ n². This is visible in the time evolution of the wavefunction.

questions.question: 8. From your graph of Energy vs Quantum Number, what type of relationship did you observe?

explanations.b: The energy plot shows a quadratic (parabolic) relationship because E ∝ n². The graph curves upward as n increases.
